    • Method Detail

      • root

        public java.util.Optional<Context> root()
        Description copied from interface: ExecutionContext
        Gets the root Context that initially triggered the execution or test of this ArtObject. The root context may not exist since ArtObjectContext objects can be constructed any time and executed any time. It will exist if this execution tree was initialized by an ArtContext.
        Specified by:
        root in interface ExecutionContext<TContext extends ArtObjectContext<?>>
        Returns:
        the ArtContext that initialized the execution tree. This may be empty if the execution was manually invoked.

      • parent

        public java.util.Optional<ArtObjectContext<?>> parent()
        Description copied from interface: ExecutionContext
        Gets the parent of this ExecutionContext that was directly executed before this ArtObjectContext.
        Specified by:
        parent in interface ExecutionContext<TContext extends ArtObjectContext<?>>
        Returns:
        the parent that was executed before this context. May be empty if no parent exists.

      • history

        public java.util.Collection<ArtObjectContext<?>> history()
        Description copied from interface: ExecutionContext
        Gets the full history of this ExecutionContext ordered from newest to oldest ArtObjectContext. This means the first item in the array (index 0) is the ExecutionContext.parent() of the ExecutionContext.current() context.
        Specified by:
        history in interface ExecutionContext<TContext extends ArtObjectContext<?>>
        Returns:
        immutable execution history in a stack sorted format. From newest to oldest.

      • targets

        public java.util.Collection<Target<?>> targets()
        Description copied from interface: ExecutionContext
        Gets all targets that are linked to this execution context.

        The execution context will check each target type against the next executable context and use it if they match.

        Specified by:
        targets in interface ExecutionContext<TContext extends ArtObjectContext<?>>
        Returns:
        an immutable list of targets in this execution context

      • current

        public TContext current()
        Description copied from interface: ExecutionContext
        Gets the context that is currently being executed. Can be null if the ExecutionContext was just constructed and only contains a parent context.
        Specified by:
        current in interface ExecutionContext<TContext extends ArtObjectContext<?>>
        Returns:
        current ArtObjectContext

      • store

        public <TValue> java.util.Optional<TValue> store(@NonNull
                                                 @NonNull Target<?> target,
                                                 @NonNull
                                                 @NonNull java.lang.String key,
                                                 @NonNull
                                                 TValue value)
        Description copied from interface: ExecutionContext
        Stores a value for the Target of this ExecutionContext and the current ArtObjectContext. This means a unique key is generated from the Target.uniqueId() and ArtObjectContext.uniqueId() and will be appended by your key.

        Then the StorageProvider.set(String, Object) method is called and the data is persisted.

        Use the Context.data() methods to store data that is only available in this scope and not persisted to the database.

        Specified by:
        store in interface ExecutionContext<TContext extends ArtObjectContext<?>>
        Type Parameters:
        TValue - type of the value
        Parameters:
        target - the target to store the value for
        key - storage key
        value - value to store
        Returns:
        an Optional containing the existing value
        See Also:
        StorageProvider.set(String, Object)

      • store

        public <TValue> java.util.Optional<TValue> store(@NonNull
                                                 @NonNull Target<?> target,
                                                 @NonNull
                                                 @NonNull java.lang.String key,
                                                 @NonNull
                                                 @NonNull java.lang.Class<TValue> valueClass)
        Description copied from interface: ExecutionContext
        Retrieves a persistently stored value from the StorageProvider and returns it cast to the given type. Will return an empty Optional if casting fails or the data does not exist.

        The data that is fetched will be stored under a unique key combination of ArtObjectContext.uniqueId() and Target.uniqueId().

        Use the Context.data() methods to store data that is only available in this scope and not persisted to the database.

        Specified by:
        store in interface ExecutionContext<TContext extends ArtObjectContext<?>>
        Type Parameters:
        TValue - type of the value
        Parameters:
        target - the target to get the value for
        key - storage key
        valueClass - class of the value type you expect in return
        Returns:
        the stored value or an empty Optional if the value type cannot be cast or does not exist

      • data

        @NonNull
public @NonNull java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> data()
        Description copied from interface: Context
        Get all custom data from this Scope.

        All data set like this is non persistent and only exists for the lifetime of this Scoped. Use the StorageProvider to store persistent data.

        This is custom data that was previously set to the context using Context.data(String, Object). Use custom data if you want to pass data to Context objects for a given Scoped.

        Specified by:
        data in interface Context
        Returns:
        The custom data. This is never null

      • next

        public <TNextContext extends ArtObjectContext<TArtObject>,TArtObject extends ArtObject> ExecutionContext<TNextContext> next(TNextContext nextContext)
        Description copied from interface: ExecutionContext
        Uses this ExecutionContext as a parent for the next ArtObjectContext copying over all other parents and the root context of this execution context.
        Specified by:
        next in interface ExecutionContext<TContext extends ArtObjectContext<?>>
        Type Parameters:
        TNextContext - type of the next context
        Parameters:
        nextContext - the context that will be executed next
        Returns:
        the next execution context containing the properties of this context
